messages.message: Just a big security concern, if one logs in via the prod instance and then puts in a bad url, it shows the full blown ib ui and then one can access our flow dashboard logs which shows alot of our prompts etc
@joshbronko is the same behaviour happening on dev / uat as well?  We haven’t restricted the instabase platform in our prod instance yet.  The plan is to do it by EOD today.
Can you give me an example.  I tried navigating to: https://aihub.uat.instabase.com/this/is/a/bad/url which redirected me to a Not Found page.
correct which one can go to apps and then flow dashboard
Ah, there is a discrepancy between logingless and logged-in mode.  @Ashish @Sabyasachi Roy @Balaram something for us to chew upon.
to confirm, i am logged in but we should restrict most of our old url,s including the flow dashboard
I can also get myself all the way into the fs system to see my local drive and all the contents
You can do Bad URL / Admin / Subspace / Click on my-repo. the the launch button
yeah, as soon as I logged in, I could do everything as well
explorer was locked down to the begining of my drive which went to not found
but thru admin you can find the new path
I think uat and dev don’t do URL restriction for the sake of developers who develop against those environments like frontend stuff.
@Eric Han should this be working on prod?
@joshbronko @shaunak Since we need to deploy model packages and debug some stuffs, we have kept the URLs open. This will become more restricted in next few days.

hi! we have intentionally kept these URLs open for developers to continue dev and test. we will start tightening this up next week.

@shaunak i think we will need a process to access these URLs via a backdoor (kubectl proxy?) :slightly_smiling_face:
